Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of deductions from facts in refugee claim
Basis_of_Claim: Political opinion, Membership in a particular social group
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Burden of proof not met, Changed country conditions in El Salvador
Assessment_Standard: Presumption of truth for facts, not for deductions
Application_Factor: Credibility, Burden of proof, Country conditions
Authority: Refugee Appeal Division, Federal Court jurisprudence
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Presumption of truth applies to facts, not deductions; court intervenes only if deductions are unreasonable
Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence to meet burden of proof despite credibility, changed circumstances in El Salvador
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to establish nexus between fear and protected grounds
Credibility_Issues: None found â€“ applicant deemed credible
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of tribunal's factual deductions
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court review of refugee claim)
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
